title: King Vuniyayawa
text:
King Vuniyayawa (born 13 March 1995) is a <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a>an <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and forward for the mighty <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford Red Devils</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a> and <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fiji</a> at international level.
Background.
Vuniyayawa was born in <a href="Lautoka%2C%20Fiji">Lautoka, Fiji</a>.
Career.
In 2018, Vuniyayawa was selected to represent <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fiji</a> vs <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a>. Vuniyayawa made his NRL debut in Round 1, 2020, in the Warriors' 20–0 loss against the <a href="Newcastle%20Knights">Newcastle Knights</a>.
Leeds Rhinos.
On 16 Jan 2021 it was reported that he had signed for the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
